New Records: Francisco Lindor hit his 31st homer of the season
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor led off the ninth inning with a solo home run to tie the game
The Mets scored the go-ahead run on Pete Alonso's sacrifice fly before piling on for a 6-2 victory
Francisco Alvarez joined the party with a three-run homer that gave the Mets plenty of cushion
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza uttered the letters 'M-V-P' when discussing his star shortstop Francisco Lindor
The Mets haven't been no-hit since Oct. 3, 2015
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor said that he has never really quantified how big his hits are, but it felt really good to hit the game-tying home run
Manager Carlos Mendoza said that Francisco Lindor is a special player, special person and MVP
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets wore caps in honor of the 9/11 first responders
The Mets moved a game ahead of the Braves in the race for the NL's third wild card
Others: The game was played on the 23rd anniversary of the attacks at the World Trade Center
Francisco Lindor wore a special multi-colored glove in honor of the 9/11 first responders
